alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 3:34PM MST until May 20 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Castle Creek upstream of Lake Pleasant in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain...up to 2 inches has already fallen due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... East Fork Castle Creek, Bitter Creek, Amazon Gulch, Hamlin Wash, Whipsaw Creek, Ash Creek, Banty Creek, Tussock Spring Creek, French Creek, Buckhorn Creek, Little Buckhorn Creek, Black Butte Wash, Buzzard Roost Creek and Castle Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Castle Hot Springs and Lake Pleasant. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
